title.rendered: 7 Best Apps For Moving & Organized Packing

content.rendered:
We know how stressful and messy the moving experience can be. There’s a lot to manage between the planning, moving, and the process of discarding your old stuff and getting new! But don’t worry, with this blog’s help you can build on a systematic plan and enjoy the move! We’ve compiled a list of the best apps for moving in 2023. These will guide you with organized groundwork, packing, and settling into your new home.

Let’s get started!

Useful Moving Apps For Organization and Planning

1. Sortly

Sortly is an inventory management service with a fun app for organized packing as you prepare to move. You can make a list of goods, group them, and even use a QR code label on each box to keep track of where they are.

Related: Avoid Rental Scams By Using A Craigslist Alternative For Rooms

This is one of the few apps for moving that’s ideal for the super-organized! You can easily scan a QR code to get a rundown of what’s in a box after moving day to make life simpler. Monthly plans range from $25 to $59, although there is also a free version designed just for moving.

Related: 8 Boxes to Tick on Roomi’s Moving in Checklist

Best Apps For Moving That Focus On Task Assistance

2. Dolly

Look no further than moving app- Dolly, if you’re doing a small relocation and just need a few items moved. For your moving, delivery, and hauling needs, it allows you to employ local laborers and truck owners. It’s perfect for apartment transfers in big cities like NYC, where individuals have less belongings and many don’t own a car.

If you own a car, you may hire a labor-only mover to assist you with loading, unloading, moving furniture, and other bulky goods. Also, if you need Donation collection and drop-off, storage transfers, and trash disposal are all also available through Dolly’s assistants.

Related: 20 Super Important Questions To Ask Your Landlord Before Moving In

3. Todolist

Todolist, as the name suggests, is for those who love making lists! We know relocating can be a stressful experience, and so having a task management app for moving, along with effective moving company software, can ease the process. You have a hundred little things to complete in addition to the big tasks like packing, moving, and unpacking.

These include transferring utilities, setting up regular rent or mortgage payments, and changing your address with the post office. With the todoist app, you can keep track of everything. Pricing plans range from $3-$5 per month, with a free plan available. Sweet Process also has a free template to create your own moving checklist.

4. TaskRabbit

TaskRabbit is one of the few free apps to use for moving. It connects freelancers with individuals who need tasks completed fast. Whether you need someone to tend your lawn, assemble your IKEA furniture, or transport your things, you’ll surely find someone on the app to help you out.

Non-planners will benefit from this because same-day employees are frequently available, especially if you live in a major city. So, if you decided last minute that you don’t want to move things yourself and need to hire movers, TaskRabbit is great!

Related: 6 Tips To Clean And Organize Your Room To Welcome The New Year

Moving Apps For Buying and Selling Items

There’s a good possibility you’ll stumble upon stuff you no longer need or have room for when you move. So, why not sell these items for some additional cash instead of tossing them away?

5. OfferUp

OfferUp is the largest mobile marketplace for buying and selling products locally. Simply take pictures of the products you want to sell, describe them, and determine the price. Buyers can send you a message using the app, make an offer, and then meet you to pick up the item. Although listing is free, sellers can pay to “boost” their listings in order to attract more customers.

Related: Affordable Furniture Shops To Buy From When Living In NYC

6. Facebook Marketplace

When it comes to apps for moving, Facebook Marketplace has become a popular site to buy and sell secondhand items. Just as in the classified section of the newspaper, you can put things you don’t need, up for sale on Facebook. It’s also useful if you’re seeking for some low-cost old furnishings to equip your home.

To Wrap Up

There are many things to be done simultaneously before, during, and after a move. With technology at the core of our daily lives, there is an app for just about anything. With our best apps for moving listed above, you can hire a moving company, purchase goods, and managing checklists and budgets.

If you are planning to move and still looking for someone to move with, Roomi can help. Having a roommate can useful for splitting rental costs and let’s face it, co-living can be super fun!

With Roomi’s great roommate matching algorithm, you have comprehensive filters based on amenities, property types and layouts. Compatible roommate finding made easy!

In addition to having specific roommate filters and roommate background checks, Roomi has no monthly subscription fees. It’s safe, guarantees your privacy, and ensures what you want in a roommate is what you get.

With ever-increasing lists of rentals, Roomi can help you find the perfect room and roommate. Download the app here and hop on the easiest ride home, ever!
